thread.title: Kid Fish to return Saturday to Lakeside Park | Local News | dailysentinel.com
thread.title_full: Kid Fish to return Saturday to Lakeside Park | Local News | dailysentinel.com

author: ANDREW HODGE Staff Writer
title: Kid Fish to return Saturday to Lakeside Park | Local News | dailysentinel.com
text:
Anglers from ages 1 to 16 will compete in a pint-sized fishing tournament Saturday morning during the annual Kid Fish.
The tournament, hosted by Nacogdoches Parks and Recreation, is 9 a.m. to noon Saturday at Lakeside Park, 4800 Pearl St.
January 23, 2025
Anglers from ages 1 to 16 will compete in a pint-sized fishing tournament Saturday morning during the annual Kid Fish.
The tournament, hosted by Nacogdoches Parks and Recreation, is 9 a.m. to noon Saturday at Lakeside Park, 4800 Pearl St.
Participants can take home up to five rainbow trout, and more than 770 will be available to catch along with other fish found in the pond.
Trout require cold water and cannot survive in Texas year-round, which is why Kid Fish happens in January.
Prizes will be given for largest trout, smallest trout, heaviest string of five fish and largest overall fish. Last year, the largest overall fish was caught by 9-year-old Blain Stanford, who caught a trout weighing 0.9 pounds.
The event is free with no fishing license required, but participants should bring their own fishing gear if they have it, plus a supervising adult. As children catch fish, they will be registered for prizes at the weigh-in station at the pond.
Nacogdoches Fire and Rescue will also attend the event to grill sausages.
Andrew Hodge's email is andrew.hodge@dailysentinel.com.
